detaileddescription.para: This method returns the height from which you look from.
This method sets the height from which you look from. It should be called on real entities only.

detaileddescription.para: This method returns a list of entities that can be seen by the associated entity. This returns a new reference to a Python object.
This method updates the set of visible entities. It tells the script about any changes.
This method is called when an entity has entered the Vision Range.

parameterdescription.para: The entity that entered vision range.

detaileddescription.para: This method is called when an entity has left the Vision Range.

parameterdescription.para: The entity that left vision range.

detaileddescription.para: This method sets the vision controller connected with this EntityExtra.
This method sets the visibility controller connected with this EntityExtra.
This method returns the visible height.
This method sets the visible height. It should only be called on real entities.
This method returns whether or not this entity can be seen.
This method sets whether or not this entity can be seen.
This method returns the angle of the vision cone in radians.
Deprecated. Use visionAngle() instead.
This method sets the angle of the vision cone in radians.
Deprecated. Use visionAngle() instead.
This method returns the angle of the vision cone in radians.
This method sets the angle of the vision cone in radians.
This method returns the vision range.
This method sets the vision range.
This method returns the dropped entity position for the purposes of vision.
This method is called by VisionController::startReal when it has entities from an onload.
This helper method is used to call a script method on the associated entity.
Static method to determine whether or not the given entity can be seen.
This class has extra entity stuff for the implementation of vision on the server
